DataElement.preferredName: Residual Malignant Neoplasm Post Surgical Procedure Longest Measurement
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Measurement of largest residual invasive cancer site in millimeters

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Residual Malignant Neoplasm Post Surgical Procedure
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A tumor composed of atypical neoplastic, often pleomorphic cells that invade other tissues remaining after a diagnostic or treatment procedure is performed by manual and/or instrumental means, often involving an incision and the removal or replacement of a diseased organ or tissue; of or relating to or involving or used in surgery or requiring or amenable to treatment by surgery

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Remaining or left behind.:A tumor composed of atypical neoplastic, often pleomorphic cells that invade other tissues.  Malignant neoplasms usually metastasize to distant anatomic sites and may recur after excision.  The most common malignant neoplasms are carcinomas (adenocarcinomas or squamous cell carcinomas), Hodgkin's and non-Hodgkin's lymphomas, leukemias, melanomas, and sarcomas. -- 2004

Concepts.definition: A neoplasm composed of atypical neoplastic, often pleomorphic cells that invade other tissues. Malignant neoplasms often metastasize to distant anatomic sites and may recur after excision. The most common malignant neoplasms are carcinomas, Hodgkin and non-Hodgkin lymphomas, leukemias, melanomas, and sarcomas.

Property.preferredDefinition: Post; occuring after.:A diagnostic or treatment procedure performed by manual and/or instrumental means, often involving an incision and the removal or replacement of a diseased organ or tissue; of or relating to or involving or used in surgery or requiring or amenable to treatment by surgery.

Concepts.definition: Happening at a time subsequent to a reference time; later in time or order.

A diagnostic or treatment procedure performed by manual and/or instrumental means, often involving an incision and the removal or replacement of a diseased organ or tissue; of or relating to or involving or used in surgery or requiring or amenable to treatment by surgery.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: any measurements of a patient's surgical margins.

DataElementConcept.origin: COG CRF:Children's Oncology Group Case Report Form
DataElementConcept.changeDescription: Changed from CTEP to COG for by script Thu Jan 2 10:00:57 EST 2014

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: the primary or longest diameter measurement in millimeters used to calculate the longest bidimensional measurement for a lesion or tumor.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: any measurements, including linear dimensions, volume, and weight, of a patient's tumor.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: Having the greater length of two or the greatest length of several.:Measurement; the size or magnitude of something.

Concepts.definition: Having the greater length of two or the greatest length of several.
Annotation used to indicate the size or magnitude of something that was determined by comparison to a standard.

ReferenceDocuments.name: Largest diameter of residual
ReferenceDocuments.description: Largest diameter of residual invasive cancer (for T Stage) in mm

DataElement.changeDescription: Curated to support Breast Oncology Local Disease (BOLD) Initiative
